name: Pre-Tool Validation Hook
description: Validates tool inputs before execution to prevent common errors
hookScript:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Pre-Tool Validation Hook
# Validates tool inputs before execution

read -r input

# Parse JSON input
tool_name=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_name // "unknown"')
parameters=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.parameters // {}')

# Example validations
case "$tool_name" in
  "Write"|"Edit")
    file_path=$(echo "$parameters" | jq -r '.file_path // ""')
    if [[ -z "$file_path" ]]; then
      echo "Error: file_path is required for $tool_name"
      exit 1
    fi
    ;;
  "Bash")
    command=$(echo "$parameters" | jq -r '.command // ""')
    if [[ "$command" =~ rm.*-rf.*/ ]]; then
      echo "Warning: Destructive command detected - please confirm"
      exit 1
    fi
    ;;
esac

echo "Validation passed for $tool_name"
exit 0

name: Auto Commit Tracker
description: Automatically tracks file changes and suggests commits after significant edits
hookScript:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Auto Commit Tracker
# Suggests commits after file modifications

read -r input

# Parse tool output
tool_name=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_name // "unknown"')
file_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.parameters.file_path // ""')

# Only track Write/Edit operations
if [[ "$tool_name" != "Write" ]] && [[ "$tool_name" != "Edit" ]]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Check if file is tracked by git
if [[ -n "$file_path" ]] && git ls-files --error-unmatch "$file_path" &>/dev/null; then
  # Check if file has uncommitted changes
  if git diff --quiet "$file_path"; then
    exit 0
  fi
  
  echo ""
  echo "ğŸ“ Modified: $file_path"
  echo "ğŸ’¡ Consider committing your changes with: git add $file_path && git commit"
fi

exit 0
